item.title: Medline’s IPO underscores broad investor appetite for a sleepy corner of the healthcare business
item.description: Medline’s stock soared more than 40% above its IPO price on Wednesday, its first day of trading.

item.title: Micron blows past expectations, and the stock is climbing
item.description: Micron has been a victim of souring AI sentiment lately, but its upbeat outlook has Wall Street now feeling better about the path forward.

item.title: ‘We all have economic jitters’: After the Fed cut rates, should my son buy a $600K house?
item.description: “They are tuned in to friends and colleagues, who are losing jobs, cognizant of shifts in company agendas and financial worries.”

item.title: ‘Am I simply the unloved son?’ My mother ghosted me after my father died. Is she stealing his money?
item.description: “No phone calls, no holiday cards, no explanation, no anything.”

item.title: Flu season is ‘early’ and ‘aggressive’ in New York City. Here’s what that means for the rest of the country.
item.description: A new variant called H3N2 subclade K is causing most of the illness this season
